chapters/intro.title: 1 — Introduction: Why Microchips Matter
chapters/intro.description: Microchips power phones, laptops, AI accelerators, cars, and cloud servers. Each advanced chip hosts billions of transistors wired together in nanoscale patterns.

chapters/photolithography-basics.title: 2 — Photolithography Basics (Analogy-Driven)
chapters/photolithography-basics.description: Photolithography is like projecting a stencil onto photosensitive paint. A mask carries the pattern; optics image it onto photoresist on the wafer; development reveals the pattern; etch transfers it into materials.

chapters/why-euv-rayleigh.title: 3 — Why EUV? The Rayleigh Criterion
chapters/why-euv-rayleigh.description: The fundamental physics of light limits how small features we can print. The Rayleigh criterion tells us the minimum feature size achievable with optical lithography.

intro.title: Welcome to EUV Lithography Guide
intro.description: This site is built with Docusaurus, using MDX (Markdown + React) to provide an accessible, interactive learning experience for next-generation semiconductor manufacturing.
